results.title: Snowy Mountain riders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
In the Snowy Mountains of southern New South Wales, near Jindabyne, there is to be a horse meeting to honour the first settlers of the district. The film shows the rounding-up and breaking-in of wild brumbies for the picnic race meeting and comments on the change in the district over the years. Narrated by Ron Iddon.

results.title: Brush with royalty
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A group of artists from Broken Hill prepare for an exhibition of their work in London. Artists include Pro Hart and Jack Absalom, and all use the countryside around Broken Hill as their source of inspiration. This film is recommended for students in Years 9-12.

results.title: The People v the 'roo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
The kangaroo is observed in its own environment, and the people who are most likely to affect its future are interviewed: the grazier, the wildlife officer, the shooter and the pet food supplier.

results.title: Part time
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student fo rthe 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A short documentary depicting four secondary students’ part time job (bakery, sales/retail, supermarket and gymnastics instructor). Questions such as how much does one earn, how they got the job and how they spend their money are all investigated.

group_siblings.title: Attack of the strange insects from Uranus

results.title: Genre
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A day in the life of a blocked screenwriter. A film producer is harassing a screenwriter who is suffering major problems trying to come up with a script for his next movie. This short film visually depicts the film scenarios this writer conjures up - a mystery and gangster style thriller. Neither of these stories satisfy the frustrated screenwriter, and so he ends up writing a simple love story between two ordinary people. Finally he finishes the script and rushes to the post box to send his script to the producer. Upon arriving at the letter box, he meets the woman of his dreams. His screenwriting dreams become a reality.

results.title: Shadow
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Two girls sitting on a bench discuss the recent events of a girl at their school who got drunk at a party and was subsequently raped. While the two characters are having this conversation, a subtitle runs along the bottom of the film, recounting another version of the story that they are discussing.

results.title: Lost
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A girl finds herself entrapped in a bizarre fantasy land when she goes to a park and is invited to play by a group of ghostly figures…is it real, or just part of a dream?

results.title: Social psychology (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James B. Lipscomb, Joel Gold, Carole Hart and CRM Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”.
Discusses psychological concepts applicable to the social problems arising from the school bussing of black children to previously all white schools. Interesting juxtaposition between the integrated classroom, and interviews with those who are opposed to bussing black children to all white schools. Emphasises the skill of the classroom teacher in being aware of preserving a positive self-image among the black children.

results.title: Attack of the strange insects from Uranus
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This mockumentary, depicting the zombie apocalypse, contains a hilarious collection of violence and gore. (Note that some scenes may disturb some viewers).
